bill.summary:
FDA Modernization Act 3.0
This bill requires the Food and Drug Administration (FDA) to publish an interim final rule implementing a provision of the Consolidated Appropriations Act of 2023 that authorized the use of certain alternatives to animal testing to support investigational use of a new drug.
The rule must replace references to animal tests, data, studies, models, and research with references to nonclinical tests, data, studies, models, and research throughout the FDAâ€™s regulations governing investigational new drug applications, and may make other changes to the regulations as appropriate.
The rule must be published within one year of the billâ€™s enactment, and must take immediate effect as an interim final rule.
